snippet: States have until Friday to tell the Obama administration whether they want to create their own health insurance exchange — a deadline Republican lawmakers had hoped would not come to pass.
abstract: Many Republican-led states are coming up against deadline to tell Obama administration whether they want to create their own health insurance exchange--deadline Republican lawmakers had hoped would not come to pass.

byline.original: By ABBY GOODNOUGH and MICHAEL COOPER
byline.contributor: Abby Goodnough reported from Des Moines, and Michael Cooper from Las Vegas. Jeff Zeleny contributed reporting from Las Vegas and Jess Bidgood from Boston.

lead_paragraph: States have until Friday to tell the Obama administration whether they want to create their own health insurance exchange — a deadline Republican lawmakers had hoped would not come to pass.

headline.main: Health Law Has States Feeling Tense Over Deadline
headline.print_headline: Health Law Has States Feeling Tense Over Deadline

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
